letters.description: Establishing a non-directive, secure therapeutic container that allows the client to feel safe enough to explore vulnerable emotions.
Utilizing toys, art, and metaphors to help the client externalize internal conflicts and project their inner world onto the play environment.
Building a deep emotional resonance with the client by mirroring their play and validating their non-verbal communications.
Implementing interactive games and sensory activities designed to develop emotional self-control and nervous system regulation.
Solidifying cognitive and emotional breakthroughs through physical movement and somatic play to ensure lasting behavioral change.
